headline: US Stock Market Today S&P 500 Futures Edge Higher As Factory Strength Supports Growth
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Tuesday, Feb, 3 2026 US stock futures are slightly higher this morning, with E mini S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 contracts up around 0.5%, as investors react to stronger US factory data and steady bond yields. The ISM Manufacturing PMI, a key scorecard for factory activity, sits at 52.6 for January 2026, which signals expanding output and potentially firmer demand for goods. At the same time, the 10 year Treasury yield around 4.27% keeps borrowing costs...

headline: Disney names theme parks chief Josh D'Amaro as next CEO
summary: The Walt Disney Company announced Tuesday that Josh D'Amaro, head of its theme parks division, will replace Bob Iger as chief executive when the entertainment titan steps down in March.In a concurrent move, Dana Walden, co-chairman of Disney Entertainment, was named president and chief creative officer -- a new role in which she will report directly to D'Amaro and oversee creative output across the company.

content.title: Disney names theme parks chief Josh D'Amaro as next CEO
content.summary: The Walt Disney Company announced Tuesday that Josh D'Amaro, head of its theme parks division, will replace Bob Iger as chief executive when the entertainment titan steps down in March.In a concurrent move, Dana Walden, co-chairman of Disney Entertainment, was named president and chief creative officer -- a new role in which she will report directly to D'Amaro and oversee creative output across the company.

headline: Disney parks chief Josh D’Amaro named to succeed Bob Iger as CEO
summary: Disney has named its parks chief Josh D’Amaro to succeed Bob Iger as the entertainment giant's top executive.  D’Amaro is the Disney Experiences Chairman, spearheading efforts for the company’s theme parks, cruises and resorts.  The decision on the next chief executive at Disney comes almost four years after the company's choice to replace Iger went badly, forcing Iger back into the job.

The decision on the next chief executive at Disney comes almost four years after the company's choice to replace Iger went badly, forcing Iger back into the job.

headline: Disney taps parks head Josh D'Amaro as CEO to lead post-Iger era
summary:
STORY: Walt Disney named theme parks head Josh D'Amaro as CEO on Tuesday (February 3).

It ends years of questions about who would take over from current boss Bob Iger.

54-year-old D'Amaro is due to start the role in March.

He's a longtime Disney insider and takes charge as AI and a wave of consolidation hits the media industry.

Iger is credited with shaping the modern Disney.

That's largely through deals for huge production brands like Pixar, Lucasfilm and 21st Century Fox.

Succession questions have long been a weakness for the entertainment giant.

It has delayed Iger's retirement a number of times.

Iger also returned four years ago to replace his chosen successor, Bob Chapek, after the pandemic hurt business.

D'Amaro currently runs Disney's experiences unit, which is the company's biggest profit engine and makes up almost 60% of earnings.

The unit includes theme parks and cruises.

Sales have grown every year in the division after the pandemic slowed five years ago.

And it scored a record operating profit of nearly $10 billion last year.

But a recent fall in international visitors to the U.S. has weighed.

Analysts have also said D'Amaro is little known in Hollywood.

It could be a challenge when generative AI tools threaten to reshape the entertainment business.

And a new round of labor negotiations are due to begin this year with the industry's major guilds.

Competition has also grown as Netflix and Paramount try to buy Warner Bros assets.

Either combination is expected to lead to a major streaming and studio rival.

Iger is credited with shaping the modern Disney.

That's largely through deals for huge production brands like Pixar, Lucasfilm and 21st Century Fox.

Succession questions have long been a weakness for the entertainment giant.

It has delayed Iger's retirement a number of times.

Iger also returned four years ago to replace his chosen successor, Bob Chapek, after the pandemic hurt business.

D'Amaro currently runs Disney's experiences unit, which is the company's biggest profit engine and makes up almost 60% of earnings.

The unit includes theme parks and cruises.

Sales have grown every year in the division after the pandemic slowed five years ago.

Either combination is expected to lead to a major streaming and studio rival.

headline: Disney earnings to pickup in second half of 2026 on streaming and parks strength
summary: Investing.com -- Walt Disney’s shares still offer upside as profits are set to grow at a double-digit pace from fiscal 2026, driven by improving streaming results and steadier growth at its parks business, Morgan Stanley analysts say. The Walt Disney Company has also announced Tuesday that Josh D’Amaro will become the company’s next Chief Executive Officer, effective March 18, 2026, succeeding Robert A. Iger.

content.title: Disney earnings to pickup in second half of 2026 on streaming and parks strength
content.summary: Investing.com -- Walt Disney’s shares still offer upside as profits are set to grow at a double-digit pace from fiscal 2026, driven by improving streaming results and steadier growth at its parks business, Morgan Stanley analysts say. The Walt Disney Company has also announced Tuesday that Josh D’Amaro will become the company’s next Chief Executive Officer, effective March 18, 2026, succeeding Robert A. Iger.

headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday: PayPal, PepsiCo, AMD, Disney
summary: ↘️ Pfizer (PFE): The drugmaker reported lower quarterly sales and swung to a loss, as demand for its Covid-19 vaccine and antiviral drug continued to decline. Shares lost about 4%. ↘️ NXP Semiconductors (NXPI): The Dutch chip maker reported higher quarterly sales and guided for further revenue growth, as management sees rising demand.

headline: Disney Names Parks Chief D’Amaro as New CEO, Succeeding Iger
summary: Disney  has named  Josh D’Amaro  as its new chief executive officer, putting the man in charge of the theme parks and cruise ships, which have become its biggest source of profits, atop America’s best-known entertainment brand.  D’Amaro will succeed  Bob Iger  to become the ninth leader of Disney in its 102-year history.  D’Amaro won a challenging bake-off for the job against Disney’s entertainment co-Chairman  Dana Walden  that has been the talk of Hollywood for more than a year.

D’Amaro won a challenging bake-off for the job against Disney’s entertainment co-Chairman  Dana Walden  that has been the talk of Hollywood for more than a year.

headline: Disney board taps Josh D’Amaro to succeed retiring CEO Bob Iger
summary: Josh D’Amaro, once the president of Walt Disney World, will become the CEO of Walt Disney Co., replacing Bob Iger, the company announced Tuesday. D’Amaro, 54, has been chairman of Disney Experiences worldwide since May 2020. He was leader of WDW from November 2019 to May 2020. “I am immensely grateful to the board for entrusting me with leading a company that means so much to me and millions ...

headline: Disney parks chief Josh D’Amaro will take over for Bob Iger as CEO
summary: Disney has named its parks chief Josh D’Amaro to succeed Bob Iger as the entertainment giant's top executive.  The so-called Experiences division has been a substantial money maker for Disney, with $36 billion in annual revenue in fiscal 2025 and 185,000 employees worldwide.  The 54-year-old takes over a time when Disney is flush with box-office hits like “Zootopia 2” and “Avatar: Fire and Ash”  and its streaming business is strong.

The so-called Experiences division has been a substantial money maker for Disney, with $36 billion in annual revenue in fiscal 2025 and 185,000 employees worldwide.  The 54-year-old takes over a time when Disney is flush with box-office hits like “Zootopia 2” and “Avatar: Fire and Ash”  and its streaming business is strong.

headline: What does new Disney CEO Josh D'Amaro need to do to boost stock?
summary: Disney (DIS) has officially tapped Josh D'Amaro, the chairman of its parks and experiences division, to take over as CEO effective March 18. Bloomberg Intelligence senior media analyst Geetha Ranganathan comments on what D'Amaro can do or the areas he will focus on to help raise Disney's stock. Also watch Geetha Ranganathan explain why Josh D'Amaro taking the helm will "underscore" the importance of Disney's theme parks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: What does new Disney CEO Josh D'Amaro need to do to boost stock?
content.description:
Disney (DIS) has officially tapped Josh D'Amaro, the chairman of its parks and experiences division, to take over as CEO effective March 18.

Bloomberg Intelligence senior media analyst Geetha Ranganathan comments on what D'Amaro can do or the areas he will focus on to help raise Disney's stock.

Also watch Geetha Ranganathan explain why Josh D'Amaro taking the helm will "underscore" the importance of Disney's theme parks.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: Disney (DIS) has officially tapped Josh D'Amaro, the chairman of its parks and experiences division, to take over as CEO effective March 18. Bloomberg Intelligence senior media analyst Geetha Ranganathan comments on what D'Amaro can do or the areas he will focus on to help raise Disney's stock. Also watch Geetha Ranganathan explain why Josh D'Amaro taking the helm will "underscore" the importance of Disney's theme parks. headline: Walt Disney Names Parks Chief  as Next CEO. The Job Won’t Be Easy.
summary: Walt Disney  has named current Disney Experiences Chairman Josh D’Amaro as its next CEO.  D’Amaro, who has led the experiences business since 2020, is expected to take over from longtime chief executive Bob Iger after the company’s annual meeting on March 18.  “There is no limit to what Disney can achieve, and I am excited to work with our teams across the company and brilliant creative partners to honor Disney’s remarkable legacy while continuing to innovate, grow, and deliver exceptional value for our consumers and shareholders,” D’Amaro said in a news release.

content.title: Walt Disney Names Parks Chief  as Next CEO. The Job Won’t Be Easy.
content.summary: Walt Disney  has named current Disney Experiences Chairman Josh D’Amaro as its next CEO.  D’Amaro, who has led the experiences business since 2020, is expected to take over from longtime chief executive Bob Iger after the company’s annual meeting on March 18.  “There is no limit to what Disney can achieve, and I am excited to work with our teams across the company and brilliant creative partners to honor Disney’s remarkable legacy while continuing to innovate, grow, and deliver exceptional value for our consumers and shareholders,” D’Amaro said in a news release.
